llm_text:
Why:
- payment_format_ach (value=1) — largest positive SHAP (≈+2.90); the ACH payment format was the primary driver increasing the model score.
- amount_received (value=15968.2) — positive SHAP (≈+0.90); the high received amount contributed to increasing the score.
- amount_paid (value=15968.2) — positive SHAP (≈+0.76); the high paid amount likewise increased the score.
- dayofweek (value=6) — positive SHAP (≈+0.78); occurrence on day 6 (Sunday) increased the score.
- from_bank (value=908) — negative SHAP (≈−0.92); the sending bank ID 908 reduced the model score (a mitigating factor).

Conclusion:
- The model flagged this transaction mainly because it was an ACH (payment_format_ach=1) with a relatively high amount (amount_received and amount_paid ≈15968.2) occurring on dayofweek=6, all of which increased the risk score. The sending bank (from_bank=908) partially offset that effect. 
- If one interprets these drivers as the model does, the combination of ACH + high, matching paid/received amounts on a Sunday explains why the alert was generated, while from_bank=908 reduces the overall score.
